#Prep & counts from relative abundance ---
```{r}

  mutate(
    study = factor(study),
    Timepoint = factor(Timepoint),
    Total_read_count = as.numeric(Total_read_count),
    Abundance = as.numeric(Abundance)
  ) %>%
  filter(!is.na(Abundance), !is.na(Total_read_count), Total_read_count > 0) %>%
```

## Calculate presence across different sequencing depth
```{r}
# Reference depth D* (use same D* for all outputs)
D_star <- median(df$Total_read_count, na.rm = TRUE)

D_star_min <- min(df$Total_read_count, na.rm = TRUE)

summary(df$Total_read_count, na.rm = TRUE)
D_star_1stQ <- 6397106
D_star_3rdQ <- 57788480
D_star_max <- max(df$Total_read_count, na.rm = TRUE)

df_std <- df %>%
  mutate(
    # calculate the rate of S aureus counts detected per sequenced read, multiply with one depth across all samples
     present_actual   = (vfdb_count  >= 1),
    adj_count_min = (vfdb_count / Total_read_count) * D_star_min,
    adj_count_min = (vfdb_count / Total_read_count) * D_star_min,
      present_min   = as.integer(adj_count_min >= 1),
adj_count_1stQ = (vfdb_count / Total_read_count) * D_star_1stQ,
      present_1stQ   = as.integer(adj_count_1stQ >= 1),
adj_count_median = (vfdb_count / Total_read_count) * D_star,
present_median   = as.integer(adj_count_median >= 1),
adj_count_3rdQ = (vfdb_count / Total_read_count) * D_star_3rdQ,
present_3rdQ   = as.integer(adj_count_3rdQ >= 1),
adj_count_max = (vfdb_count / Total_read_count) * D_star_max,
present_max   = as.integer(adj_count_max >= 1),
adj_rel   = adj_count_median / D_star )

```

```{r}
#------------------------------------------------------------
# Prepare transformed values (avoid log(0))
df_std <- df_std %>%
  mutate(
    count_pseudo = vfdb_count,
    adj_count_pseudo = adj_count_median,
    depth_pseudo = Total_read_count
  )

# Function to fit lm on log10 scale & extract R², r, p
get_stats <- function(x, y) {
  # log-transform safely
  lx <- log10(x + 1)
  ly <- log10(y + 1)
  fit <- lm(ly ~ lx)
  smry <- summary(fit)
  r2 <- smry$r.squared
  r  <- sqrt(r2) * sign(coef(fit)[2])
  p  <- smry$coefficients[2,4]
  list(r2 = r2, r = r, p = p)
}

stats_before <- get_stats(df_std$Total_read_count, df_std$present_actual)
stats_after  <- get_stats(df_std$Total_read_count, df_std$present_median)

#------------------------------------------------------------
# Scatterplots with pseudo_log_trans
plot_scatter <- function(df, x, y, stats, title) {
  label <- paste0(
    "R² = ", round(stats$r2, 3),
    ", r = ", round(stats$r, 3),
    ", p = ", signif(stats$p, 3)
  )
  
  ggplot(df, aes(x = {{x}}, y = {{y}})) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.6) +
    theme(aspect.ratio = 1) +
    scale_x_continuous(trans = pseudo_log_trans()) +
    scale_y_continuous(trans = pseudo_log_trans()) +
    labs(
      title = title,
      subtitle = paste("Depth reference D* =", format(D_star, big.mark=",")),
      x = "Total read count",
      y = deparse(substitute(y))
    ) +
    
    annotate("text",
             x = max(df$Total_read_count, na.rm=TRUE),
             y = min(df[[deparse(substitute(y))]], na.rm=TRUE)+1,
             label = label,
             hjust = 1, vjust = 0, size = 4, fontface = "bold", color='red')
}

p_before <- plot_scatter(df_std, Total_read_count, present_actual,
                         stats_before, "Before depth adjustment")

p_after  <- plot_scatter(df_std, Total_read_count, present_median,
                         stats_after, "After depth adjustment")

p_before
p_after
```

```{r}

short_map
# N per study×timepoint (for labels)
```

```{r}
# Fit logistic regression
fit <- glm(I(vfdb_count > 0) ~ log10(Total_read_count), 
           data = df, family = "binomial")

# Extract coefficient for log10(Total_read_count)
coef_est <- coef(summary(fit))["log10(Total_read_count)", "Estimate"]
coef_se  <- coef(summary(fit))["log10(Total_read_count)", "Std. Error"]
p_val    <- coef(summary(fit))["log10(Total_read_count)", "Pr(>|z|)"]

# Odds ratio and 95% CI
OR  <- exp(coef_est)
CI  <- exp(c(coef_est - 1.96*coef_se, coef_est + 1.96*coef_se))

# Format label
label_text <- paste0("OR = ", round(OR, 2),
                     " (", round(CI[1], 2), "-", round(CI[2], 2), ")\n",
                     "p = ", signif(p_val, 3))
ggplot(df, aes(x = log10(Total_read_count), 
               y = as.integer(vfdb_count> 0))) +
  geom_jitter(height = 0.02, alpha = 0.4) +
  stat_smooth(method = "glm", 
              method.args = list(family = "binomial"), 
              se = FALSE, color = "blue") +
  labs(x = "log10(Total reads)", y = "virus genes detected unadjusted (0/1)") +
  annotate("text", x = 5, y = 0.9,   # adjust position as needed
           label = label_text,
           hjust = 0, size = 4)
```

```{r}

# ---- 1) Which presence columns do you have? ----
presence_cols <- c("present_actual", "present_min", "present_1stQ",
                   "present_median", "present_3rdQ", "present_max")

# ---- 2) Helper to coerce presence-like columns to 0/1/NA ----
to_bin <- function(x) {
  # returns integer vector: 1 = present, 0 = absent, NA = missing
  if (is.logical(x)) {
    return(ifelse(is.na(x), NA_integer_, as.integer(x)))
  }
  if (is.numeric(x)) {
    return(ifelse(is.na(x), NA_integer_, as.integer(x)))
  }
  # character-ish
  x_up <- toupper(as.character(x))
  dplyr::case_when(
    x_up %in% c("TRUE","T","1")  ~ 1L,
    x_up %in% c("FALSE","F","0") ~ 0L,
    TRUE                         ~ NA_integer_
  )
}

# ---- 3) Make a cleaned dataframe with binary presence cols ----
df_clean <- df_std %>%
  mutate(across(all_of(presence_cols), to_bin))

# ---- 4) Per-sample collapse: "any gene present (TRUE/FALSE/NA)" per depth ----
#    NA means: this sample had no non-missing gene rows for that depth
per_sample_any <- df_clean %>%
  group_by(sample_alias, study, Timepoint) %>%
  summarise(
    any_actual  = ifelse(sum(!is.na(present_actual)) == 0, NA, sum(present_actual == 1, na.rm = TRUE) >= 1),
    any_min     = ifelse(sum(!is.na(present_min)) == 0,    NA, sum(present_min == 1, na.rm = TRUE) >= 1),
    any_1stQ    = ifelse(sum(!is.na(present_1stQ)) == 0, NA, sum(present_1stQ == 1, na.rm = TRUE) >= 1),
    any_median  = ifelse(sum(!is.na(present_median)) == 0, NA, sum(present_median == 1, na.rm = TRUE) >= 1),
    any_3rdQ    = ifelse(sum(!is.na(present_3rdQ)) == 0, NA, sum(present_3rdQ == 1, na.rm = TRUE) >= 1),
    any_max     = ifelse(sum(!is.na(present_max)) == 0, NA, sum(present_max == 1, na.rm = TRUE) >= 1),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

per_sample_any <- per_sample_any %>% 
   mutate(
    study_short = ifelse(study %in% names(short_map),
                         short_map[as.character(study)],
                         as.character(study)),
    Timepoint = factor(Timepoint, levels = time_levels),
    study_short = factor(study_short, levels = study_order)) 

n_study <- per_sample_any %>% 
    group_by(study_short, Timepoint) %>%
  summarise(
    n_total = n()) %>%                        # number of samples in that
  # helpful label for plotting on x-axis (shows denominator used)
  mutate( 
    x_label = paste0(as.character(study_short), ", N=", n_total),
    x_key   = paste(Timepoint, x_label, sep = "|")
  ) %>%
  group_by(Timepoint) %>%
  arrange(study_short, .by_group = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()

prev_by_study_tp_any <- per_sample_any%>%
  group_by(study_short, Timepoint) %>%
  summarise(
    prev_actual = mean(any_actual, na.rm=TRUE),
    prev_min    = mean(any_min, na.rm = TRUE),
    prev_1stQ   = mean(any_1stQ, na.rm = TRUE),
    prev_median = mean(any_median, na.rm = TRUE),
    prev_3rdQ   = mean(any_3rdQ, na.rm = TRUE),
    prev_max    = mean(any_max, na.rm = TRUE),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  left_join(n_study, by = c("study_short","Timepoint")) 

levels_prev <- prev_by_study_tp_any %>%
  arrange(Timepoint, study_short) %>%
  pull(x_key) %>% unique()

prev_by_study_tp_any <- prev_by_study_tp_any %>%
  mutate(x_key = factor(x_key, levels = levels_prev))

hline_data_prev <- prev_by_study_tp_any %>%
  group_by(Timepoint) %>%
  summarise(hline_y = median(prev_median, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

prev_by_study_tp_any %>% 
ggplot(aes(x = x_key, fill = study_short)) +

  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +
```

# Heatmap for all virulence gene pos samples at median seq depth
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(pheatmap)
library(RColorBrewer)

# 1) Ensure present_median is binary numeric (0/1) or NA
#    Choose whether you want to treat NA as 0 (unobserved -> absent) or keep NA to show as special color.
#    Here I'll fill NAs with 0 (comment the values_fill line below if you prefer NA)
df_clean <- df_clean %>%
  mutate(
    present_median = case_when(
      is.na(present_median) ~ 0L,            # <- use 0 for NA; change to NA_integer_ if you want NA kept
      present_median %in% c(TRUE, "TRUE", 1) ~ 1L,
      TRUE ~ 0L
    )
  )

# 2) Pivot to OTU x Sample, filling NAs with 0 so matrix is numeric
heatmap_df_sample <- df_clean %>%
  select(OTU, Sample, present_median) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = Sample, values_from = present_median, values_fill = list(present_median = 0))

# 3) Make matrix and ensure numeric
heatmap_mat <- as.matrix(heatmap_df_sample %>% select(-OTU))
rownames(heatmap_mat) <- heatmap_df_sample$OTU
mode(heatmap_mat) <- "numeric"   # force numeric mode (safe)

# 4) Optionally drop samples or OTUs with all zeros to declutter
#    (you had code selecting columns where sum > 0; here we do both rows and cols)
heatmap_mat <- heatmap_mat[rowSums(heatmap_mat, na.rm = TRUE) > 0, , drop = FALSE]
heatmap_mat <- heatmap_mat[, colSums(heatmap_mat, na.rm = TRUE) > 0, drop = FALSE]

# 5) Prepare metadata (columns) - ensure rownames match matrix colnames and in same order
metadata_df <- df_clean %>%
  select(study, Sample, Timepoint, s_aureus_pos) %>%
  distinct(Sample, .keep_all = TRUE) %>%
  column_to_rownames("Sample")

# Subset + reorder to exactly match heatmap columns
metadata_df <- metadata_df[colnames(heatmap_mat), , drop = FALSE]

cohort_colors <-  c("PRIMAL"= "#88C9BF", "Gibson"= "#BDBDBD", "Rahman" ="#969696",
                    "Gasparrini"=  "#636363", "Pärnanen"="#4D4D4D","Morrow"= "#D9D9D9")

# Rename / factor levels for annotation consistency
metadata_df <- metadata_df %>%
  rename(`Postnatal age` = Timepoint) %>%
  mutate(
    study_short = ifelse(study %in% names(short_map),
                         short_map[as.character(study)],
                         as.character(study)),
    Cohort = factor(study_short, levels = names(cohort_colors)),   # keep same order
    `Postnatal age` = factor(`Postnatal age`, levels = c("DOL 1-8","DOL 9-42","DOL 43-455")),
    `S. aureus pos.` = factor(as.character(s_aureus_pos), levels = c("FALSE","TRUE"))
  )


metadata_df$study <- NULL
metadata_df$study_short <- NULL
metadata_df$s_aureus_pos<- NULL

# 6) Row annotation: only keep OTUs present in the heatmap_mat
row_anno <- df_clean %>%
  select(OTU, Category) %>%
  distinct() %>%
  filter(OTU %in% rownames(heatmap_mat)) %>%
  column_to_rownames("OTU") %>%
  rename(`Gene category` = Category)

# Build colors for gene categories with stable mapping to levels present
unique_cats <- sort(unique(row_anno$`Gene category`))
n_cat <- length(unique_cats)
vfdb_palette <- colorRampPalette(brewer.pal(12, "Set3"))(n_cat)
row_colors <- list(`Gene category` = setNames(vfdb_palette, unique_cats))

# 7) Annotation column colors (your existing definitions)

annotation_colors <- list(
  Cohort = cohort_colors,
  `Postnatal age` = c("DOL 1-8" = "lightblue", "DOL 9-42" = "darkblue", "DOL 43-455" = "purple"),
  `S. aureus pos.` = c("FALSE" = "black", "TRUE" = "pink")
)

all_colors <- c(annotation_colors, row_colors)

# 1) Make summary labels with N
cohort_counts <- table(metadata_df$study_short)
cohort_labels <- paste0(names(cohort_counts), ", N=", cohort_counts)

sapos_counts <- table(metadata_df$s_aureus_pos)
sapos_labels <- paste0(names(sapos_counts), ", N=", sapos_counts)

# 8) Finally, draw the heatmap.
#    If you kept NAs (did NOT fill them with 0), pass na_col to show them e.g. grey.
hm <- pheatmap(
  heatmap_mat,
  color = c("lightgrey", "#55998A"),          # binary color for 0/1
  breaks = c(-0.5, 0.5, 1.5),                 # maps 0->first color, 1->second color
  cluster_rows = TRUE,
  cluster_cols = TRUE,
  border_color = NA,
  angle_col = 45,
  fontsize_row = 8,
  fontsize_col = 8,
  show_colnames = FALSE,
  annotation_col = metadata_df,
  annotation_row = row_anno,
  annotation_colors = all_colors,
  legend_breaks = c(0, 1),
  legend_labels = c("Absent", "Present"),
  na_col = "grey90"   # only used if you kept NA values instead of turning them to 0
)

# Save to PDF
pdf("heatmap_absence_presence_virulence_genes_medianSeqDepth.pdf", height = 12, width = 14)
grid::grid.draw(hm$gtable)  # draw the heatmap grob
dev.off()
```

```{r}
test_df <- df_aureus %>%

  do(
    broom.mixed::tidy(

      effects = "fixed",
      conf.int = TRUE,    # get CI directly
      conf.method = "Wald"
    )
  ) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(
    OR = exp(estimate),
    OR_low = exp(conf.low),
    OR_high = exp(conf.high),
    fdr = p.adjust(p.value, method = "BH"),
    fdr = round(fdr, digits = 5),
    significance = case_when(
      fdr > 0.05 ~ "ns",
      fdr < 0.001 ~ "***",
      fdr < 0.01 ~ "**",
      fdr < 0.05 ~ "*"
    )
  )
```

# Run PERMANOVA on samples that have virulence genes only (excluding 0 samples)
```{r, fig.height=4, fig.width=8}
library(vegan)
library(ape)
library(ggplot2)
df_clean %>% 
  filter(s_aureus_pos==T) %>% # to keep it consistent with pre
  select(Sample,present_median,OTU) %>% 
  pivot_wider(names_from = Sample, values_from = present_median)

# 1. Transpose so samples are rows
vfdb_mat_clean <- vfdb_mat[ rowSums(vfdb_mat, na.rm = TRUE) > 0, ]#Remove all-zero genes (rows)
vfdb_mat_t <- t(heatmap_mat)

# 2. Keep only samples with at least one gene
nonzero_samples <- rowSums(vfdb_mat_t) > 0
vfdb_mat_nonzero <- vfdb_mat_t[nonzero_samples, ]

library(vegan)
# 3. Compute Jaccard distance
vfdb_dist <- vegdist(vfdb_mat_t, method = "jaccard", binary = TRUE)

# 4. Run PCoA
pcoa_res <- pcoa(vfdb_dist)

# 5. Prepare plotting dataframe
pcoa_df <- as.data.frame(pcoa_res$vectors[, 1:2])
pcoa_df$Sample <- rownames(pcoa_df)

# add metadata
pcoa_df <- pcoa_df %>% 
  left_join(md_cat_new, by = c("Sample"= "ID"))

# 6. Plot
ggplot(pcoa_df, aes(x = Axis.1, y = Axis.2, color = study_id)) +#, shape = timepoint_category
  geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(
    x = paste0("PCoA1 (", round(pcoa_res$values$Relative_eig[1] * 100, 1), "%)"),
    y = paste0("PCoA2 (", round(pcoa_res$values$Relative_eig[2] * 100, 1), "%)"),
    title = "PCoA on VFDB presence/absence (Jaccard, samples with genes only)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")+
  facet_wrap(~timepoint_category)

metadata_df_aureus<-metadata_df_aureus %>% 
  mutate(Country= case_when(Cohort=="PRIMAL"~"Germany", T~"US"))

# 5. Run PERMANOVA (example: Cohort + timepoint_category as predictors)
set.seed(123)  # for reproducibility
permanova_study <- adonis2(vfdb_dist ~ Cohort, data = metadata_df_aureus)
permanova_country <- adonis2(vfdb_dist ~ Country, data = metadata_df_aureus)
permanova_tp <- adonis2(vfdb_dist ~ `Postnatal age`, data = metadata_df_aureus)

permanova_inter <- adonis2(
  vfdb_dist ~ Cohort * `Postnatal age`,
  data = metadata_df_aureus,
  by = "terms"
)

permanova_ic <- adonis2(
  vfdb_dist ~  Country*Cohort,
  data = metadata_df_aureus,
  by = "terms"
)


# 6. Inspect results
print(permanova_study)
print(permanova_tp)
print(permanova_ic)
print(permanova_inter)
```
